com.nttdocomo.ui
Class Display

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.nttdocomo.ui.Display
public class Display
extends java.lang.Object

This defines the view of a device. The display class is a class that abstracts the UE screen and keypad. This is used to obtain information on the screen and keypad.

Method Detail

getCurrent

public static Frame getCurrent()
This obtains the frame displayed on the screen.

Returns:
The frame.

getHeight

public static int getHeight()
This obtains the screen height.

Returns:
The screen height in pixel units.

getWidth

public static int getWidth()
This obtains the screen width.

Returns:
The screen width in pixel units.

isColor

public static boolean isColor()
This checks whether or not the screen supports color displaying.

Returns:
This shall return "true" if the screen supports the color display, and "false" otherwise.

numColors

public static int numColors()
This obtains the number of colors that can be used on the screen.

Returns:
The number of colors when isColor() is true, and the number of gray labels when isColor() is false. It returns 2 in the case of monochrome binary.

setCurrent

public static void setCurrent(Frame frame)
This sets the current frame. When the frame is set, the set frame is displayed on the screen. However, the dialog cannot be set. When an attempt is made to set the current frame from another thread while the dialog is displayed, the frame shall be shown after the dialog is closed.

Parameters:
frame - Designates the frame.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when null is designated for the argument frame.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when the argument frame is Dialog.
